title: Nature at its best
review: Its very close to Nainital with scenic roads to explore vast varieties of birds. Thought roads are narrow but you hardly find any traffic.. Its a must visit in your list.

title: terrible
review: the places are well marked in all itenaries and travel maps but on ground its not even marked or guided properly. we drove on the entire stretch twice without finding the place or routes.

title: This is at the distance of 10km from Hotel Uttaranchal Inn and 8 km from Uttaranchal Restaurant.
review: This road also called as the coolest road as the sun rays reaches here in the early morning and than after only cool airs and light which makes this road more populer among the travellers.

title: Serene Nature
review: Watch beautiful birds all along the road. Enjoy the journey having stop overs and photo sessions and spur your creativity.

title: A perfect area for birding
review: We loved everything about Pangot. It is a special place and well-worth the journey up there. There are so many birds even though we went at a less-good time of the year for sightings.

title: Go there for the Roads
review: The roads leading to this place will leave you speechless! Such beauty, such greenery, such serenity and such tranquility leaves you wonderstruck! Pangot is located some 15 km from Nainital and about 9 km from Himalayan View Point. The road is narrow and dangerous, but lovely and should not be missed.

title: good place. Can be better
review: It is a nice place. If you are into birding, you need to reach here early. This place gets crowded very soon as the day moves in.

title: Nice and peaceful place..
review: This is a famous wildlife sanctuary surrounding Nainital... The place is peaceful and offers some great views of the wildlife...

title: Birders heaven!!
review: Located away from the city this beautiful place for Bird watching is must visit place for Birders. Go early in the morning to see birds. This is famous wildlife sanctuary near Nainital. Enjoy great views and enjoy photography.

title: Excellent place for bird watching.
review: Panghot is almost 15 kms from Nainital, it is quite picturesque.The weather is highly unpredictable, at times there is heavy sunlight, then another hand there are the quick rain showers. I have visited Panghot both in the month of June and July, I would not suggest visiting the place in the month of July, due to heavy monsoons, you will go all the way uphill and will locate nothing. May is still a better option and it is not overcrowded like Nainital.

title: Silent Beauty
review: If you are going to Nainital, do give a day or two for Pangot. It is just 15 kms aways from Nainital and easily accessible from there too. It is a silent beauty and a hub for birds lovers. Pangot is so beautiful and is away from the maddening crowd.

title: Beautiful Place
review: The place is simply amazing.Infact a small village with a handful of people few resorys and excellent view.The wether of the place changes after every 15 min.Sometimes clouds come down suddenly sunlight would come.The place is simply a heaven's in hills.A ride to the place from nainital.is also very picturesque .You can see the mighty snow clad Himalayan ranges all throughout the journey.The place is very renowned world over for bird watching.Some exclusive birds can only been seen here only.A must visit if visiting Nainital.

title: A Place to relax
review: No hustle no bustle just have the full rest with nature . No tring tring no internet what's a cool life .

title: JUNGLE
review: famous for Bird, Nature, Flora, Photshoots, no entrance fees and this place is for full day visit

title: A beautiful and quiet place!
review: Pangot and Killbury Bird Sanctuary, despite being located only 15 kms from Nainital is a beautiful place with its pristine beauty still untouched. Its a very quiet place since very few tourists come here. The journey to the bird sanctuary itself will fill the mind of every nature lover with joy. The relative quietness of this place (as comapred to Nainital) coupled with the fact that the road goes through a dense forest lends a surreal beauty to this place. It will surely be loved by bird lovers but if you are hoping to see lots of exotic birds, you will be disappointed.

title: very quite and hidden
review: this area need to be explored in details if u love nature ... the area has many waterfalls and dense forest ... numerous bird species.. animals including tiger so be carefull .. gud place for camping .. no roadsso ready to walk

title: Just average
review: Even after spending three hours we could not spot much. Visit this place only if you are on a long trip

title: Town in the Hills.
review: I liked pangot because of its extreme greeny. I personally love to have long drives in mountain & spend time in green areas so this was place was perfect for me.

title: Mesmerising...
review: The road to Pangot is mesmerising!! lush green mountains, narrow single lane roads, absolutely no traffic and the beautiful mist that gives it a heavenly feeling. Well there's no specific place to reach... this area is just about experiencing tranquility. Park your car, take a chair (and a cutting Chai) from the local "Chai Wala" and enjoy the clouds leisurely passing by or take a long stroll with the clouds... the time is all yours!

title: Tranquil & very natural
review: It's about 10-15 km from Nainital. The drive itself is enthralling as the road is narrow and devoid of any commercial/residential establishment. All forest area throughout with breathtaking views of valley, rocks, forests & birds. It was raining at the time we visited this area, which made it more attractive and left lasting impressions on us.

title: Pure nature
review: The place is located 15-17kms from the hustle-bustle of Nainital and is surely a must visit. You can trek to a stream and shiv temple roughly 1km from Pangot to find a beautiful stream or travel in a vehicle to far off places such as villages which are 16kms from Pangot and would require a full day trek. If trekking far, make sure to hire a guide because its a complete jungle area and even a single wrong bend can drift you far off. Also, the signals are nearly absent at Pangot, but are intermittent in the jungle area. Moreover, the view of Himalayas from the jungle is splendid and one can spot birds in Kilbury forest nearby really early in the morning. Also, don't forget to keep ample cash because no other form of monetary transfer is possible in Pangot.

title: An experience for lifetime
review: Please do take some time to visit this place if you are in Nainital/Bhimtal. A perfect destination to rejuvenate your mind. Surrounded by the Himalayan ranges (Kumaon/Garhwal) it offers a breathtaking taking view. Also, one can stay at Kampland Nature resort in Pangot. Words really fall short to describe the serenity of the place.

title: Panoramic view
review: Pangot was what I would catagorized it as the heaven of earth. An Idyllic destination. Himalayan Birds like fusibity woodpeckers, forktail etc can easily be seen here.

title: Peace and quiet
review: Naina Devi Himalayan Bird Conservatory Reserve, the official title, is an area of forest reached along a picturesque road from Nainital. I am a lazy bird-watcher so arrived at 11am at Pangoot. Was lucky enough to find a guide who had an hour before his next booking. Had a lovely time seeing various birds including a rufus-bellied woodpecker and a verditer fly-catcher...

title: Superb
review: One of the best places to observe Himalayan birds. Must visit for all persons interested in birdwatching as the sheer variety of birds one gets to see is stupendous.

title: Paradise
review: Amazing place for birds and nature. You can walk in any direction and you will find so many variety of Himalayan birds. This is best location for birding and photography. The area is peaceful with misty forest. Loved it.

title: Breathtaking views and fantastic birds
review: This is really a choice location to look for specialty Himalayan birds. Pangot and the surrounding area were our first stop in this India trip, and I wish there had been more places like it. Peaceful, full of life, mostly untouched... Birding along the road will yield great finds.

title: A Bird Watchers Paradise!
review: You need to be Bir watching enthusiast to drive up 30 km up the hill into the serene but quiet zone at 5 0 clock in the morning. But, once you are there a huge prospect of sighting birds are on offer. From Pheasants to Jays a paradise for Bird watchers. Take a Guide and be ready with your camera and Binoculars!

title: Very Cool Place N Pieceful
review: This is fantastic place and peaceful place. I will suggest that you can in every time. there is peaceful place.

title: Its not functioning
review: We were there and travelled all the way to Pangot from Nainital... But apparently the sanctuary is closed now.

title: Neat and clean place for food and stay on the ridge of Bhowali town facing Bhimtal!!
review: on our way back from Ranikhet to rail-head at Kathgodam, we found this excellent place for breakfast-lunch-dinner overlooking the Bhim Tal and Saat Tal area from the ridge line.The food was really scrumptious and tasty.This is a much needed stoppage on the arduous hill terrain at an altitude of about 1600 meters above sea level with bracing climate and cool wind.The owner of the cafe Mr.Bobby George from Kerala is a wonderful gentleman with courteous behavior.

title: Pangot - An Outer side of Nainital to explore
review: This trip was beginning of 2017 for us. we never thought of that we are going to have such a wonderful experience visiting here. Close to nature. calm place. enjoy with entire family here.

title: spot the lovely birds
review: you hear lot of chirping here which you will love and enjoy.  it is so very peaceful and loved spotting different kind of birds here.

title: Bird Watching
review: 12 kms. from nainital this area provide excellent oppotunity for bird photobraphy. If you have private vehicle or hired one than this place is good for 3-4 hrs. There are small restaurant and tea stall in pangot. There are few good resort are also located if you are planning to stay.

title: Awesome place
review: The place is perfect definition of lonely planet. Hotels are not good here which is the only drawback of this place. This place is much quiter and peaceful than Nainital

title: Offbeat Destination
review: It is just 10 kms from Nainital. This is the place if you want to relax in the nature. And also not to far from Nainital.Good for trekking hiking bird watching. Must visit place.

title: Great place to visit
review: Kilbury forest is one of the most unexplored regions near Nainital. Though it is told to be place for bird watchers but the journey through the forest is really refreshing. There is thick forest beside the road and cool breeze running through it will give you a soothing feelings. A nice quiet place to visit.

title: Awsome place
review: Some 12 km away from nainital is this nice place,great views on way to kilbury and pangot..Nice birds sanctuary... Enjoy 2 ,3 hours at this Clement place..Have a cup of tea at Pangot

title: Excellent Place for Bird Watchers
review: The bird Sanctuary is 12 kms away from Nainital. Very beautiful place surrounded by oak, pine & rhododendron trees. The place is very famous for Bird watching and people from around the world visit here. The place is got more than 500 species of birds. If you love nature and birds, this is the place for you.

title: Nice place to visit
review: we had our hotel close to pangot village so we had visited this place too. nice scenic beauty with great climate .

title: Serene
review: Serene, Calm, Beautiful, Peaceful... Sorry I am our of words. this place is just heaven for birders like me. Hidden places like Vinayak, Cheer point are cherry on top. A MUST VISIT.

title: Not for families - Pangot
review: This place is average like any other hill station. In fact this is remote area, so not very good option for families. This area is isolated from Nanital. Cab vendors may charge upto rs. 2500/- from Pangot to Nanital (based on season you may visit). No good options to eat/stay if you plan to stay in Pangot. Mobiles networks are not available. Not suitable and safe place for evening or night drives.

title: Mesmerizing!
review: A good place for nature lover. Though you have to be lucky enough to spot some birds but a walk or ride through the sanctuary is amazing.

title: Serene and cool
review: Beautiful place with thick forest and dry streams when we went in May. However did not see many birds.

title: Best place for bird watchers.
review: This is place approx. 30-40kms far with real narrow roads all though cars do go to this place. The place is surrounded with green mountains.

title: A place for Nature Lovers
review: We had a day trip to Pangot. The drive from Nainital to Pangot is very enjoyable and offers some excellent views of snow clad Himalayas. This small village is coming up with quite a few hotels. It was past noon by the time we reached there ,so there was no chance of going for trekking and  bird watching.It was very foggy. We had masala chai and Maggi . Talked to the boy from Bareilly who served us.

title: Peaceful
review: Away from mad rush, chaos of popular hill destination,  Pangot is a serene place perfect for relaxation. Though you will find not many birds as advertised, still I consider it as a nice break for a day or two. No shops, no tourist spots, just mountains and valleys. Perfect.

title: Small and Scenic Sanctuary
review: Pangot and Kilbury Bird sanctuary is a small and scenic hamlet.The region consists of several creeks,where animals like Leopard,Civet,Goral and deer reside.It also has different species of birds.

title: awesome area
review: best area in nainital nearby lots of wild life dense forest and silent area far from city traffic enjoy silence there

title: Heaven for bird lovers
review: This place is heaven for bird & nature lovers as route to reach this sanctuary is covered with dense green forest.There is lot of flora & fauna at this place.View of lake,dense forest & mountains is mesmerising

title: Excellent!
review: Only one section is open for tourists and its a guided tour! Its a must if you are in Nainital! its from british era and furniture and other stuffs are not touch and its in good shape!

title: Place beyond Crowd of Nainital
review: This is approx 18 km up from Nainital, a single drive with no street lights so strongly recommend to only travel during day light.  On the way, you would be able to see Himalayan range with the help of telescope.  Recommended place to stay is Premium Valley View Pangot,

title: Best Birding experience
review: A must visit place for evert genuine birder. Spend minimum 3 days to have the correct birding experience.

title: Must visit
review: This is a really beautiful and peaceful place near Nainital. The natural views and the walk is very beautiful and you will be mesmerized with the chirping of birds all the time.

title: Birdwatchers Paradise
review: Walking into Pangot is like stepping into a remote Himalayan village. This birdwatchers' paradise has more than 250 species of birds in and around. I visited this during summers and it was a perfect get away from hustle bustle of city.

title: scenic drive
review: its 40 min drive from nainital , best time to visit early morning . one can stay in camp near pangot area

title: must visit place for bird lovers!!
review: very nice place to spot some of the rare birds . In the arms of nature, this beautiful place will make you awestruck. nearly 15 km from nainital, a very good place to visit. try to be here in the early morning to spot more birds!!

title: Pangot, Birdwacher's Paradise.
review: Pangot is a small hamlet near the famous hill town of Nainital

title: Great place for birdwatching
review: Great place to be if you are a backpacker. This has hundreds of species of birds and the place is excellent for photography. Complete peace and isolation if you want to be far away from the madding crowd. The views of the night sky are beautiful.

title: Great place for bird watching
review: Drive toward the Government forestry guest house and walk though the woods. Many bird species are there but have to go early morning.

title: Nice
review: I had read suggestions here to visit this early morning but my frnds are all sleep lovers.. so unfortunately we reached Pangot arnd 11 only to find out its a small village.. We missed all the fun of early morning; however we enjoyed our mid jungle photo sessions :P

title: Drive through Nature !
review: This is approx. 15-20kms from Nainital on the route from Mallital to Kaladunghi.  Although the road is narrow but since there is very little traffic there is hardly any problem. The drive is really beautiful in midst of lush green hill forest. We did in the afternoon so were only able to see 2-3 different type of birds which we havent seen ever before. Would try to do this early in morning next time as recommended by other travellers.

title: A sleepy village - Pangot
review: Pangot is a quaint, small village nestled 15kms from Nainital and 50kms from Kathgodam. The twisting drive to this place is through the forests of Cheena Peak Range, Snow View Point and Kilbury. This place is extremely favourite among the bird watchers. It is home to an amazing variety of flora and fauna including the Leopard, Yellow throated Martan, Himalayan Palm Civet, Ghoral, Barking Deer and Sambhar.

title: Must visit if you enjoy bird watching
review: The route alone to pangot is amazing. Nainitaal is at a lower altitude but the moment you start climbing up to pangot you realise you really are out in the mountains.

title: pangot and kilbury
review: visit here to leave the noisy nainital crowd for peace ,excellent place to calm yourself from daily routine and tussle in lifes....u need just a chair and camera to relax here with lots of bird watching in d  morning..kilbury in fact has jut one house and it is really a place to view himalayan peaks....

title: Excellent dense forests overlooking Nainital
review: Overlooking Nainital. Yes you can see the entire lake from on the way to Kilbury and Pangot. Nothing to do there, just walk around in the jungles which are thick and dense. Amazing amazing place. I go there each time I visit Nainital

title: The road to Kilbury was unforgettable for us
review: Month of visit - October

title: Pangot & Kilbury Sanctuary
review: Pangot bird sanctury is a must visit place on your Nainital holiday , there is place called Sigri just two kms away from Pangot , We stayed at Sigri Camp NAinital and beauty , Silence , Peace is awesome , and early morning birding trip was great

title: Need Guts
review: Here you have to trek a lot. Pangot is around 15 kms from here and the road is very dangerous. You need guts to drive till here. But once you reach here you are amazed.

title: Bird Lovers Paradise
review: One of the most serene and peaceful breaks that i have ever taken. Pangot is a small town with a handful of hotels and is best suited for nature lovers. There are awesome trails and paths to explore. Get up early and give your body and senses a treat.

title: Bird watching
review: Scenic beauty ,and travel on road from Nainital to pangot made it very beautiful. It was raining from Nainital to Pangot , weather was good.pangot is a quite area away from rush of Nainital,peaceful. Because of rains we could n't saw any bird,but the trip till Pangot was fun!!!!If anybody wants peace it is there.

title: Wondrous drive!
review: Simply loved the drive to Pangot -- and have done it more than a couple of times since. Nice lunch rustled up at Birding Lodge at an hours notice. Nice and quiet area for nature enthusiasts.Doable as a half day trip from Nainital, if you do not wish to live there (though there are plentiful nice options to stay)

title: Walk or ride the forest
review: A long yet mostly flat trek leads you through the forest reserve of Kilbury. An early morning traverse can be a bonanza for bird lovers. Personally we love to ride through one way, and then revel in the lap of nature taking in the glorious clean air, the song of the forest and its fragrance!

title: wow
review: Beautiful drive, exceptional beauty and diversity of flora and fauna. The sheer number of birds here will be a delight for any birder. Must visit place for enthusiasts.

title: Loved this place
review: Its calm and good for those seekinh mental peace, we stayed in kafal nice ..lovely cottage and nice hospitality..

title: Nice Sanctuary
review: Bird watching and stay at Ashokas Naini Chalet, made my trip an memorable one., would suggest every one to stay at Ashoks naini chalet and make your holiday a memorable one.

title: Superb !
review: just carry you camera, tripod and a back pack and you're all set for a forest trail citing rare birds !

title: decent view , birds chirping and peaceful place
review: must go with a experience driver as roads are very narrow and sharp. with all things lie raincoat and umbrella in rain season . after reach you will really fell calm n peace here .

title: Pangot Bird Senctuary
review: Pangot is one of beautiful hamlet in the state of Uttarakhand which is  just 15 km far from Nainital. Walking into Pangot is like stepping into a remote Himalayan village. This birdwatchers' paradise has more than 250 species of birds.

title: Pangot and Kilbury Bird Sanctuary
review: India is famous world over for its rich flora and fauna. Pangot is one such beautiful hamlet in the state of Uttarakhand which lies just 15 km from the city of lake, Nainital. Walking into Pangot is like stepping into a remote Himalayan village. This birdwatchers' paradise has more than 250 species of birds in and around as recorded by Jungle Lore Birding Lodge.

title: serene envirnment
review: its the most unexplored part of nanital, not a very popular destination its away from the city but a must visit place to explore the nature a quite place but very pictures not many tourist visit

title: A dreamy ride after the noisy Nanital
review: If you feel that Nainital is not able to give to the peace, take ride to Pangot. May be you may nt visit the bird sanctury but the ride till that place will be super. Steep  valley with dense trees and a small river flowing. I think you can get down and have a uncharted trek. It would be adventurous. Post Paangot you have several treks by private companies, you can take it but it is after 10 -15 km from Pangot. I did nto have time to explore but I think u go when the snow comes.

title: Birding Paradise In India
review: hence i a a abide birder and wildlife, used to travel many places, and this place is like heaven. Happy to see that this place still have many birds. Place is close to Nainital and well connected by road. After crossing  Nainital A road leads to Pangot and Kilbury. This entire road is birding place and walk as much as you can its more than 30km stretch so go easy and enjoy every part of it. Pangot Village will be in between after almost 14 km.

title: Pangot Village
review: Stayed in Pangot at Ashokas Naini Chalet Resort.. Well maintained place surrounded by Deodar forest.

title: Fantastic place.
review: Stayed at Ashoka Naini Swiss Chalet. Clam and quite place, surrounded by Jungle. Away from hustle bustle of Nainital. Lovely view of the valleys and scenic drive of @ 16 kms from Nainital to Pangot. Beautiful birds to watch early in the morning.

title: picnic spot in the jungle
review: i can recommend a picnic spot which others can't tell. if you proceed to Pangot, just 2 km before reaching pangot we can see a bridge, if you park your vehicle there and walk towards left side along the natural steam you can have a very beautiful spot to cook food and enjoy some time in the jungle. since it is not visible from the road you can have complete privacy. only problem, the water is literally icy water, i dont think anybody can take bath there. We actually went there to enjoy some time in the natural stream. But the water was to cold too dip our feet. then my wife warned the possibility of "froze bite"

title: Good Bird Sanctaury
review: Pls do visit it if you are interested in viewing Birds. Bird watching Paradise. very peaceful also. Pls do visit

title: Kilbury road
review: This road offers beautiful Himalayan view, Forest and view of Naini lake For birders its is paradise

title: Nature at its best..!!
review: Its a beautiful place..trekking amidst the forest was a wonderful experience..lush green trees around had a very calming effect.. We stayed at the Ashoka Naini Chalet for two nights and thus went to the kilbury forest for a trek...kids really had an awesome time. one needs to go early morning to be able to c the birds

title: For solitary nature lovers
review: Kilbury is a dense forest with abundance of flora and fauna. It is a quiet place in the midst of dense forest and lovely birds migrate here. You will enjoy the solitude and calmness of the place with occassional chirps from the forest. Nice place but advisable if you are travelling in a group. Also dont go late as it becomes lonely and dark after 3pm.

title: The road of Kilbury
review: This is a great forest road to be one with nature.  However, the city crowds who come in hoards in noisy vehicles from Nainital till the viewpoint are a pain.  We may loose this road soon to these type of tourists.

title: Place for Peace and Relax
review: Never knew that such place exists in North India Hills. Very close from Nainital, yet Pangot is so far from rest of the world. A calm place returns your peace of mind and refreshes you. The journey to Pangot itself is amazing and has very nice views. One can find many unseen birds clearly chirping.

title: Nice place but read my feedback
review: If you choose to go to this place for bird watching, you have to make it at the very early morning. Challenge is during winters the sun rises not before 7 am and by that time you complete your breakfast and start from your hotel its late for bird watching. May be you can stay for a night in the Pangot area (The Nest is what we could see as an option).

title: Birding paradise
review: A must visit for every birder. Left, right center, front and back, birds everywhere. Pangot is the place to see and photograph birds.

title: lovely birds in dense forest
review: Kilbury is a dense forest with abundance of flora and fauna. It is a quiet place in the midst of dense forest and lovely birds migrate here. You will enjoy the solitude and calmness of the place with occassional chirps from the forest. Nice place but advisable if you are travelling in a group. Also dont go late as it becomes lonely and dark after 3pm.

title: Birding trial
review: Loved to see so many different species.The flora and fauna of the area is magical, I mean unbelievable. The sky so clear and the clouds contrasting whites. The hill terrain boost some of the best roads I have seen in the hill stations.

title: Far from the madding crowd
review: We were really excited about visiting Pangot and Kilibury, but had to turn back 2 kms from Kilibury due to dangerous roads owing to the snow. Its a beautiful location, untouched snow and great view of the Himalayas
